result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joel Scott Wiedenhoeft

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Joel Scott Wiedenhoeft
Current: 2117 S 6th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53215 United States  (Effective: 10-28-2022)
Prior: 3720 E Fitzsimmons Rd, Oak Creek, WI 53154 United States

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Festival Foods. Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Joel Scott Wiedenhoeft in court. Student intern Abigail Dowieko appears for the State of Wisconsin under the supervision of Attorney Thomas Potter under the student practice rule.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to the Reserve Judge, Branch 13, however, Parties are advised that effective 10/31/2022, pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-17, this case will be reassigned to Branch 37, Judge Dee in Room 515 of the Courthouse. 

Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  

The case is adjourned to Br. 37 for a Pretrial Conference.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Joel Scott Wiedenhoeft
Current: 3720 E Fitzsimmons Rd, Oak Creek, WI 53154 United States  (Effective: 10-11-2022)
Prior: 2117 South 6th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53215

Joel Scott Wiedenhoeft not in court.
The Milwaukee County Sheriff's Office has cleared the active warrant, provided the next court date to the defendant, and requested the warrant be withdrawn with approval of Deputy Chief Judge Carl Ashley. MCSO advised defendant to appear in Room 221 of the Safety Building, in person, at 1:00 PM on 10-28-2022.

***CORRECTION***
Initial Appearance was not held on 09-09-2022. Defendant did not appear in court.

Defendant Joel Scott Wiedenhoeft not in court. Student Intern Madeline Witter under the supervision of Prosecuting attorney Thomas L. Potter in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 9/9/22 @ 2p
